snippet: Electronic record systems can make health care more efficient and less expensive, but their potential for mistakes and confusion can be frustrating, costly and even dangerous.
abstract: Electronic medical record systems can make health care more efficient, cost effective and accessible, but their potential for mistakes and technological glitches can be costly and even dangerous; shift has been strongly promoted by the Obama administration.
lead_paragraph: Electronic record systems can make health care more efficient and less expensive, but their potential for mistakes and confusion can be frustrating, costly and even dangerous.

headline.seo: The Ups and Downs of Electronic Medical Records - The Digital Doctor
headline.main: The Ups and Downs of Electronic Medical Records
headline.print_headline: The Ups and Downs of Electronic Medical Records
